Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツ
Entry.EnglishText: Frantz

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋「青狼酒家」
Entry.EnglishText: Innkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋「満福商店」
Entry.EnglishText: Grocer

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: <icon:20> つまみ食い
Entry.EnglishText: <icon:20>Sneak a Bite

Entry.JapaneseText: やあ、キミたち、久しぶり！ 元気だったかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey there, you guys! It's been a while! I take it you're all doing well?

Entry.JapaneseText: うん!! フランツさんも 元気そうだネ!!
Entry.EnglishText: We sure are! You're looking pretty good yourself!

Entry.JapaneseText: おや、そちらの美しい お嬢さんはどなたかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, who might this lovely young lady be?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>さんだヨ！ <Veigue>の幼なじみの。
Entry.EnglishText: This is <Claire>! She's <Veigue>'s childhood friend.

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、キミが<Claire>さんか。 どうも、初めまして。 小生は、<Blue>世界七大まぼろし<White>を 追い求める冒険家フランツ。
Entry.EnglishText: So you're <Claire>, huh? It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm just a humble adventurer on a journey to see the <Blue>World's Seven Great Illusions<White>. The name's Frantz.

Entry.JapaneseText: は、初めまして……<Claire>です。
Entry.EnglishText: N-Nice to meet you.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかして、<Cyan>幻の庭<White>を 探している人物というのは、 フランツさん、あなたですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Frantz, are you by any chance searching for a <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: いかにも!! さては、 あの老人から話を聞いたんだな。 キミたちも<Cyan>幻の庭<White>を？
Entry.EnglishText: You betcha! I take it you also heard about it from that old man. Are you also looking for it?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>雲海にそびえし古の塔<White>と いうのを探してるんですけど、 もしかしたら<Cyan>幻の庭<White>が それじゃないかって……
Entry.EnglishText: We are actually looking for a <Cyan>tower which soars above a sea of clouds<White>, but we were wondering if perhaps they might be the same thing...

Entry.JapaneseText: 雲海にそびえし塔……なるほど。 <Cyan>幻の庭<White>も雲の上にあると言われているし、 同じ物かもしれないね。
Entry.EnglishText: A tower in the clouds, huh... Interesting. They might indeed be the same thing, considering the garden is also said to be above the clouds.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>なんて…… あのおじいさんの作り話の ような気がするんだけど？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not convinced by this <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>... Honestly, it wouldn't surprise me if that old man just made the whole thing up.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、そんなはずはない。 その証拠に「古代カレギア幻辞苑」の １２８ページに<Cyan>幻の庭<White>と<Yellow>大いなる宝<White>の 記述がある。
Entry.EnglishText: No, he couldn't have. There's a section on page 128 of "The Ancient Mysteries of Callegea" about the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White> and a "<Yellow>great treasure<White>."

Entry.JapaneseText: これにはあの「リブガロ」の事も 書かれていたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's the same book which described the Livgaro.

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん、そう言われると ホントっぽいけどなぁ…… でも、手がかりはあるのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... Well, if it's written in a book, then that's enough for me to believe it... Do you have any leads?

Entry.JapaneseText: 今のところ、有力な手がかりはないが、 なあに、慌てる事はない。 じっくり調べるさ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have anything solid right now, but whatever, right? No need to worry. I'm in no rush to investigate it.

Entry.JapaneseText: こっちは、そうは言ってられない。 すぐにでもそこに行きたいんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Can't say the same thing ourselves. We need to get there as soon as possible.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか…… それなら、ワン・ギンに 話を聞くという手もあるが……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... If that's the case, then I suppose you could try talking to Wang Gin.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン？
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin?

Entry.JapaneseText: この街の長とも言うべき人物だ。 世界中の珍しい宝を集めては、 金持ちに売りつけているらしい。 あるいは、<Yellow>大いなる宝<White>の事も……
Entry.EnglishText: He's pretty much the head honcho around here. Apparently he became very wealthy after collecting rare treasures from all over the world and selling them off. So you'd think he'd have an idea as to where that "<Yellow>great treasure<White>" might be...

Entry.JapaneseText: 会ってみるか、ワン・ギンに。
Entry.EnglishText: We should go meet with this Wang Gin, then.

Entry.JapaneseText: ただ……ワン・ギンには悪い噂も多い。 私から言い出しておいてなんだが、 できれば関わらないほうがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: Just a fair warning... I've heard a lot of unsavory rumors about the guy. Even though I did mention him to you, it might be best for you to not get involved with him.

Entry.JapaneseText: 迷っているヒマはないんだ。 こうしてる間にも、世の中は どんどんおかしくなっちまってる。 おれたちはそれを止めたいんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's no time to hesitate when the world is getting crazier and crazier as we speak. We want to get this all over with.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうか、そこまで言うなら 止めはしないが、くれぐれも ワン・ギンには注意するんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're set on it, then I won't stop you. But please, be extremely careful around Wang Gin.

Entry.JapaneseText: うん、ありがとう。 フランツさん！
Entry.EnglishText: You got it. Thanks, Frantz!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうだった？ 何かわかったかい？
Entry.EnglishText: How did it go? Did you learn anything?

Entry.JapaneseText: 情報と引き換えに オークションの終了まで ワン・ギンの用心棒を させられる事になった。
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin wants us to act as guards during his auction in exchange for information about the <Cyan>Garden<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ううん、そう来たか。 くれぐれも気を抜かないように。
Entry.EnglishText: I see. I can't say I'm surprised. Remember to not let your guard down.

Entry.JapaneseText: こっちも何か進展があれば キミたちに伝えるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll let you know if I find out anything of interest on my end.

Entry.JapaneseText: 皆さん、ご無事で 何よりです。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm happy to hear you all are safe and sound.

Entry.JapaneseText: 人をさらうような、 あんなヒドイ人のいるこの街には もういられません……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't stand being in this city with rotten people who do things like kidnapping any longer.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何より、盗賊で もうあんな怖い思いは したくないし……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want to have to think about the awful things those bandits wanted to do.

Entry.JapaneseText: しばらくしたら、 他の街に行こうかと 思ってます。
Entry.EnglishText: I've thought it over and I want to go to another city.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様のところの お迎えをやってるって？
Entry.EnglishText: You're escorting Wang Gin's guests?

Entry.JapaneseText: あらあら…… 大変ねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh my goodness...

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊が……!? よかったわ…… うちは襲われなくて……
Entry.EnglishText: Bandits?! I'm glad they didn't attack my establishment...

Entry.JapaneseText: 店の改装資金の ２０万ガルドが手元にあるのよー。
Entry.EnglishText: I have 200,000 gald on me so that I can renovate the inn!

Entry.JapaneseText: 天変地異の前触れ？ 商売やってるどころじゃないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Could this earthquake be heralding a disaster? I can't be doing business at a time like this...

Entry.JapaneseText: 安らかな眠りを提供する キョグエンの宿屋「青狼酒家」で ございます。
Entry.EnglishText: We are pleased to offer our guests a restful sleep at the Blue Wolf Inn lodgings.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>ひと晩<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが いかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Will you be spending the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>泊まんのかい……？ <unk17:340C80>ガルド置いてきな。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It's <unk17:340C80> Gald for a night. Will you be staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まる？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 よろしいでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Is that all right with you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだ。 どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Are you staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドで泊りますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><unk17:340C80> Gald to rest. Spend the night? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお寛ぎください。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり、どーぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good rest!

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようですね。
Entry.EnglishText: You've got no money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金がないのに、 泊まる気だったのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: What, did you think we'd let you stay here without paying?

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まり賃をお持ちでないようですが。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't look like you can afford to stay here.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ？ お金が足りないみたいだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? You seem to not have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないんじゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: It appears you don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足らないんですけど……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't seem to have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: それでは またの機会に。
Entry.EnglishText: See you next time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ふん…… ひやかしかい……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph... Window-shoppers...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのお越しを。
Entry.EnglishText: We hope to see you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、 泊まらないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: What, you're not going to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもどうぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: お気をつけて……
Entry.EnglishText: Take care...

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まらないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you not want to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: 雲海にそびえし塔ねえ…… 私、高いところ好きよ。
Entry.EnglishText: A tower which soars above a sea of clouds... I like tall places.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほら、なんとかと煙は 高いところがって……
Entry.EnglishText: See, look at how that smoke is rising up...

Entry.JapaneseText: し、失礼ね……!!
Entry.EnglishText: M-My bad...!!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>幻の庭<White>……？ この世は幻だらけよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Blue>Garden of Illusions<White>...? This <Italic>world</Italic> is full of illusions.

Entry.JapaneseText: 生きてる事すら幻。 わかる？
Entry.EnglishText: Even life itself is an illusion. Don't you understand that?

Entry.JapaneseText: まだまだ若いあんたたちには わからないでしょうね。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, you're still young, so I guess you wouldn't.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様が この街一番の大金持ちって 言ってるけど、あれはウソ。
Entry.EnglishText: They say that Wang Gin is the richest man in town, but that isn't true.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街どころか、 カレギアで一番かもしれないわね。
Entry.EnglishText: Forget this town, I believe that man is the richest in all of Callegea.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうそう、女王陛下よりも お金を持ってるわよ、きっと。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sure he has more money than even the Queen. Mark my words.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様のオークションで 買えないものはないのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's nothing you can't buy at Wang Gin's auctions.

Entry.JapaneseText: ただし、あなたに それを買えるだけのお金を 持ってるかどうかね。
Entry.EnglishText: That is, if you have the money needed to purchase it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊なんて もう慣れてしまいましたよ。 この街のほとんどがそうじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm already used to bandits. Is this town not full of them, after all?

Entry.JapaneseText: 反抗しなければ、 乱暴はしないし……
Entry.EnglishText: If you don't oppose them, then they won't get violent.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当に大切なものは 盗られるようなところには 置かない事ね。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't leave anything that is really important where it might get stolen.

Entry.JapaneseText: 人はガジュマとヒューマの 二種類に分けられるって言うけど、 あれウソね。
Entry.EnglishText: They say that people are divided into Huma or Gajuma, but that is a lie.

Entry.JapaneseText: あと、お金を持ってる人と 持ってない人、 これもウソ。
Entry.EnglishText: They also say that there are people with no money and people who have money. That is also a lie.

Entry.JapaneseText: 実際は、現状に満足できる人と できない人、これよね。
Entry.EnglishText: The truth is, there are people who are satisfied with their lot in life and people who are not.

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様が 演説したんですってね。
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva gave a speech.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの時代が やって来るとかなんとか。 私ガジュマだけど、どうでもいいわ。
Entry.EnglishText: She said that the era of Gajuma was upon us. I might be a Gajuma, but I couldn't care less.

Entry.JapaneseText: 世界が混乱していても、 この街の人たちはお金さえあれば、 なんとかなるって思ってる人ばかりね。
Entry.EnglishText: Even if the world is in disarray, most of the people in this town believe that so long as they have money, things will work out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 実際、お金の価値すら メチャクチャになるのにね。 もう困ったもんだわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The truth is that the value of money will get messed up as well. Then we'll all be in trouble...

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり人は 眠ってなんぼよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing beats a good night's rest.

Entry.JapaneseText: だって人生の三分の一は 睡眠に費やされるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: After all, one third of your life is spent sleeping.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気持ちよく眠る事こそ人生よ！
Entry.EnglishText: To sleep well is to live well!

Entry.JapaneseText: お疲れになったら、 いつでもどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're tired, then feel free to stay with us.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンという男は なかなか抜け目のない男だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin is a rather cunning man.

Entry.JapaneseText: 彼の腰ぎんちゃくの クウ・ホウという男も得体が知れない。 くれぐれも注意するんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: His lackey Ke Hao is suspicious as well. Be wary of both of them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 幻の庭の事で何かわかったら、 キミたちに必ず伝えにいくから。
Entry.EnglishText: If I learn anything of the Garden of Illusions, I'll make sure to let you know.

Entry.JapaneseText: 風景は綺麗だし、 雰囲気のとてもいいところだが……
Entry.EnglishText: The scenery is gorgeous and the ambience is great, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 小生はどうもこの街が 好きになれないな。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I just can't bring myself to enjoy this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『螺状窓』 昔、キョグエンで流行した 窓の形で、この街ならではのもの。 今はこの街でも螺状窓を持つのは この建物だけになってしまった。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Whelk-shaped Window - In the past, windows with this shape were popular in Kyogen, and were unique to this town. Currently, this building is the only one which still has whelk-shaped windows.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『書画』 墨で大きく書かれた文字。 この文字を発明した 書道家ネイ・サンの弟子、 ポウ・サンの作品。 「心穏やかであるべき」と いう意味らしい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Calligraphy - Large letters are written in ink. This work was created by Pao San, who was an apprentice of the inventor of these characters, Nei San. The meaning seems to be "One must remain calm."

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ♪ おいしそうなものがあるヨ！ ちょっと食べちゃおっと。
Entry.EnglishText: Ooh! Looks like there's something tasty here! Lemme take a teeny tiny bite...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『まんじゅう』を食べました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Ate "Manju."
Entry.Notes: Manju is the english translation officially

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>すると、何とビックリ！ 中に『<item:2000000E>』が入っていました。
Entry.EnglishText: ...And what do you know! There was <item:2000000E> inside of it!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:2000000E>』のレシピを入手しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained recipe for "<item:2000000E>"!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『まんじゅう』がありました。
Entry.EnglishText: There's some "Manju" here.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>……しかし、勝手に食べるのは どうかと思ったので遠慮しておきました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>...But stealing food is rude, so you refrained from doing so.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『<item:2000000E>入りまんじゅう』 以前、<Mao>がつまみ食いをした。
Entry.EnglishText: - <item:2000000E> Stuffed Manju - <Mao> already snuck a bite of this.

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんですか、 これ……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What is going on...?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 空腹は生きとし、 生けるもの最大の敵！
Entry.EnglishText: Hunger is the greatest enemy of all living things!

Entry.JapaneseText: 当店でその「敵」と戦うための 「武器」を買っていってはいかが？
Entry.EnglishText: So to fight that "enemy," why not buy some "weapons" from my store?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: お腹が空いたら、 またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back whenever you're hungry.

Entry.JapaneseText: この店の裏手の橋を 渡ったところにいるおじいさんは ものしりじいさんって呼ばれてます。
Entry.EnglishText: The man who lives across the bridge behind the store is known as the wise old man.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも誰もこの街の人は あの人の言う事を 信じちゃいませんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: However, no one in this town believes anything he says.

Entry.JapaneseText: 言ってみれば 「ものしり」っていうのは 皮肉です、皮肉。
Entry.EnglishText: So us calling him "wise" is just us making a wisecrack.

Entry.JapaneseText: ものしりじいさんと お会いになったんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did you meet the wise old man?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>幻の庭<White>だなんて、 まともに取り合っちゃ ダメですよ、あなた。
Entry.EnglishText: You can't take anything about this <Blue>Garden of Illusions<White> seriously.

Entry.JapaneseText: すぐに調子に乗るんだから、 あのじいさん……
Entry.EnglishText: He sure does like to get carried away...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様ね…… この街では信奉者は多いですがね。
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin, huh... There are a lot of people in this town who are ardent followers of him.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私？ 私はうちの商品さえ 買っていただければ、 文句は言いませんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Me? Well, as long as he's buying my produce, I'm not going to say anything against him.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ええ、言いませんとも。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Well, I won't <Italic>say</Italic> anything.

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションですか……
Entry.EnglishText: An auction, huh...

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギアのどこかにあるという 幻のレシピが出品されたら、 行くんですけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: If that Recipe of Illusion that I've heard about gets put up for sale, then I might go.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかって？ さあ、南の方だって 聞きましたけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: Where might that be? Well, I've heard something about it being from the south.

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊は我々の敵です。 なまじお金があるから、 この街は狙われるんでしょうね。
Entry.EnglishText: Bandits are our enemy. They probably target this town because there's a lot of money coming through here.

Entry.JapaneseText: かと言って、これ以上は 生活水準は落せないし……
Entry.EnglishText: That being said, no one is willing to lower their standard of living.

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王陛下がねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: The Queen, huh...

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下はご病気で伏せってるって噂、 ウソだったんですね。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess that rumor that they were hiding that the Queen was ill was a lie.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだと思ってたわ…… きっとお城の生活がイヤになって…… ……そんな事あり得るのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: I had thought that was the case... I guess the Queen got tired of living in the castle... But is such a thing even possible?

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街は種族問題で ゴチャゴチャしてるみたいですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Other towns are having trouble between the races.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街はそんな事はないんだけど…… でもなんかこの街も おかしい気がするのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: That's not the case here... Though I still feel as though there is something off about this town...

Entry.JapaneseText: 世界はこのまま一体、 どうなってしまうのかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: What is going to happen to our world...?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの食材には外れなし！
Entry.EnglishText: My goods are all good!

Entry.JapaneseText: 絶対、買っていってね！
Entry.EnglishText: So please, buy some!

Entry.JapaneseText: お腹が空いたら、 行き倒れになる前に 必ずおいでよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're ever hungry, make sure to stop by before you waste away.
